page.title: 12Public Houses
page.content: All the public houses are on the main routes through the survey area. {Red Lion}- A Benskins pub beside the road to Leighton Buzzard where it crosses the River Gade. Provides food during the day. Entertainments include darts. pool and crib. Has a beer garden. {Crown and Sceptre}- A free house at the top of the hill above the Red Lion on the road to Gaddesdon Row, in the village of Bridens Camp. There has been a public house there for 350 years. Serves about 200 people throughout the day on Fridays, its busiest day. Entertainments include darts, cribs and cards. {The Chequers}_ A free house along Gaddeson Row that has been there since 1720. Previously there was a farmhouse on the site. Has a Beer Garden and serves sandwiches as well.
